item.title: Trump Tries to Move Hush-Money Case to Federal Court Before Sentencing - The New York Times
item.description:
1. Trump Tries to Move Hush-Money Case to Federal Court Before Sentencing  The New York Times
  2. Trump asks federal court to take over Bragg case weeks before sentencing  Fox News
  3. Stormy Daniels Trial Trashed by Trump Attorneys in New Filing: 'Zombie Case'  Newsweek
  4. Trump asks federal court to seize N.Y. hush-money case  Axios
  5. Trump asks federal court to intervene in hush money case in bid to toss conviction, delay sentencing  POLITICO

item.title: Russian attack on playground, residential building kills at least 4 in Ukraine
item.description: In Kharkiv, a Russian guided bomb hit a residential area, killing at least four people, including a child, and injuring more than 28. Mayor Ihor Terekhov detailed the tragic incident, emphasizing the loss on a playground. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged Western allies to authorize long-range strikes on Russian military air bases to deter future attacks.

item.title: ‘The race is wide open’: MPs’ vote looms for six Tory leadership hopefuls
item.description:
Badenoch and Jenrick are the bookies’ favourites but the party’s reduced ranks make the numbers extremely tight

When the Conservative MPs who remain return to Westminster, they will briefly seem like some of the most popular people in SW1. With the party so reduced in numbers, the next few days will see a furious wooing of those who have not yet declared for one of the six leadership candidates.

“The race is wide open,” one senior Tory said. “There are barely any public endorsements so no one can tell who is the favourite. The public polling has been all over the place. Often they seem to be just based on who has paid for it.”

Continue reading...

item.title: Controversial Trump biopic to receive pre-election release in US
item.description:
The Apprentice, an 80s-set drama with a scene where he sexually assaults his wife, will get an October release

Controversial Donald Trump biopic The Apprentice is set for a pre-election release in the US.

According to the Hollywood Reporter, the film which premiered at the Cannes film festival, will be released theatrically in the US on 11 October, less than a month before the election.

Continue reading...
